reference.title: Character Formats
reference.shortdesc: Character formats allow you to override paragraph formats when you need to change the format attributes for a small amount of text.

section.p:
For example, you can use character formats when you want to italicize or underline a specific word in a paragraph without overriding the existing paragraph format.
Bold The Bold format allows you to stress certain words or phrases throughout your content.
Code The Code format allows you to apply a monospace font to text that will appear as code in your content.
Emphasis The Emphasis format allows you to italicize certain words or phrases throughout your content.
Hyperlink The Hyperlink format applies a blue font and underline to text, which allows you to clearly display URL addresses and other links as clickable items.
Sub The Sub format allows you to apply a subscript font to text. Any text with the Sub format applied displays below the baseline of the normal text.
Super The Super format allows you to apply a superscript font to text. Any text with the Super format applied displays above the baseline of the normal text.
Underline The Underline format allows you to add an underline underneath text.
